list.item: A function is a mapping from a set of inputs to a set of outputs with exactly one output for each input.
If no domain is stated for a function the domain is considered to be the set of all real numbers for which the function is defined.
When sketching the graph of a function each vertical line may intersect the graph, at most, once.
A function may have any number of zeros, but it has, at most, one y-intercept.
To define the composition the range of f must be contained in the domain of g.
Even functions are symmetric about the y-axis whereas odd functions are symmetric about the origin.
